AbortController.summary: The AbortController interface represents a controller object that allows you to abort one or more Web requests as and when desired.

remarks.para: You can create a new AbortController object using the constructor. Communicating with an asynchronous operation is done using an object.

AbortControllerAbort.summary:
The abort() method of the interface aborts an asynchronous operation before it has completed.
This is able to abort fetch requests, the consumption of any response bodies, or streams.

AbortControllerAbortController.summary: The AbortController() constructor creates a new object instance.

AbortControllerSignal.summary: The signal read-only property of the interface returns an object instance, which can be used to communicate with/abort an asynchronous operation as desired.
